intro: Hennecartia, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. Hennecartia species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. They are often found in disturbed soils and can become invasive in certain environments.
